alert.note: Alert for South Washington Coast (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 08 at 2:32AM PST until January 08 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...HIGH SURF WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TUESDAY TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, Sneaker waves possible. For the High Surf Warning, large waves and dangerous surf conditions. Breakers up 28 to 35 feet likely. * WHERE...In Oregon, North Oregon Coast and Central Oregon Coast. In Washington, South Washington Coast. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, until 4 AM PST early this morning. For the High Surf Warning, from 4 AM Tuesday to 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Destructive waves may wash over beaches, jetties, and other structures unexpectedly. People can be swept off rocks and jetties and drown while observing high surf. Severe beach erosion may destroy coastal properties and buildings. Higher than normal water run-up is expected on beaches and low-lying shoreline. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surfing, swimming, fishing, boating, and observing large waves from rocks or coastal structures during high surf conditions is dangerous. All large waves are not alike. There is often an extra large breaker that can suddenly sweep a person overboard or off a large rock with no warning. The safest place to be during high surf conditions is in port and well away from breaking waves.
info.instruction: A High Surf Warning means that high surf will affect beaches, producing rip currents, sneaker waves and beach erosion. Stay well back from the water`s edge and be alert for exceptionally high waves. Keep away from large logs on the beach. Water running up on the beach can lift or roll logs which can injure or kill someone caught in their path. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
